The purpose of the HIRDLS SIPS (Science Investigator-led Processing System) is to generate HIRDLS higher-order standard data
products and associated quality assurance information from HIRDLS lower-order standard data products and from ancillary data

column2: and to provide for the appropriate distribution
but no less important purpose of the SIPS is to allow a high degree of interactivity

column1: The SIPS is composed of a large array of processors and support systems and is located at the University

column2: HIRDLS group laboratory in Boulder Colorado. Instrument data called production data sets (PDS)

column1: are delivered from the NASA EOS Computing System (ECS) in Goddard Space Flight Center
Maryland in the USA in two hour granules only about 4 hours after being delivered from the spacecraft. These
data are processed at the SIPS by first being geo-located and calibrated to produce level 1 files
then geophysical products are retrieved to produce level 2 files. Level 3 files are gridded data. These
products are delivered to the Distributed Archive system (DAAC) at Goddard where they are copied to the
British Atmospheric Data Centre (BADC) at the Rutherford Laboratories in Oxfordshire.
